Key Match Events: Jalen Green scored 22 of his 29 points in the third quarter, leading the Houston Rockets to a 135-112 victory over the Washington Wizards.
Alperen Sengun added 26 points and 10 rebounds for the Rockets.
Amen Thompson scored 20 points and grabbed 15 boards.
Houston put the game away with a 21-6 third-quarter run to extend its lead to 95-74.
Washington's 18 turnovers led to 35 Houston points, the most a Wizards opponent has scored directly from giveaways this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Washington leading scorer Jordan Poole missed his second straight game with a bruised left hip.
Kyle Kuzma exited at halftime with a bruised right calf.
A marginally improved 4-10 stretch will be hard to sustain if Poole and Kuzma miss more time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Houston overcame a 20-point first quarter — the fewest points allowed by last-place Washington in a period this season.
